message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper deals with developing an automatic segmentation method for pelvic magnetic resonance (MR) images using a novel convolutional neural network called Attention-Pyramid network (APNet). This involves addressing challenges such as the various sizes and shapes of pelvic organs, the similarity in appearance of different organs, and the limited availability of annotated images. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a data-augmentation technique and uses deep learning techniques, which makes it likely to belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Additionally, the use of MR images makes it relevant to cs.MM (Multimedia).
